instruction: How did the researchers train and evaluate their deep learning model for compound identification in this research on the automatic detection of complex polymorph structures from Raman signatures?
Output: The researchers trained and evaluated their deep learning model for compound identification by using the publicly-available RRUFF spectral database. They synthesized and identified different TiO2 polymorphs for model validation purposes. The model was trained using Convolutional Neural Networks and Long Short-Term Memory networks. The performance and accuracy of the proposed framework were evaluated based on its ability to correctly identify pure Anatase and Rutile with a high degree of confidence. Additionally, the model was able to identify defect-rich Anatase and modified Rutile based on their modified Raman Spectra. The key component, Anatase, from the P25 Degussa TiO2 was also correctly identified by the model.
